sentences: Mees ja naine vaatavad koos televsioonit.
context: The word 'vaatavad' is the 3rd person plural present tense form of the Estonian verb 'vaadata', which means 'to look at', 'to watch', or 'to observe'. It's used when referring to multiple people who are currently performing the action of looking/watching. The ending '-avad' indicates this is the present tense for plural subjects (they).
